In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **backtick** symbol (**\`**) serves the following purposes:

- \` represents [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") by default. This can be changed with the [*boulder* option](/wiki/Options#boulder "Options"), with the [0](/wiki/0 "0") glyph (0) being a popular choice.

* Pressing [\`]() opens up the [discoveries](/wiki/Discoveries "Discoveries") menu, which lets you view what items you have [identified](/wiki/Identified "Identified") in each object class, whether formally or by [type-name](/wiki/Type-name "Type-name").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)

## Historical uses

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, \` also represented [statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of monsters. Starting in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), statues instead use the glyph of the depicted monster.

## Variants

Some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 continue to use \` to represent statues.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") uses the same glyphs for statues as NetHack 3.4.3.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), \` is used for statues as well as [statue monsters](/index.php?title=Statue_\(monster_class\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Statue (monster class) (page does not exist)"), a new [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"). The glyph is used by the following monsters:

- \` [Punisher](/wiki/Punisher "Punisher")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

`

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the backtick symbol (`) serves the following purposes:

  • ` represents boulders by default. This can be changed with the boulder option, with the 0 glyph (0) being a popular choice.
  • Pressing ` opens up the discoveries menu, which lets you view what items you have identified in each object class, whether formally or by type-name.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 UnNetHack

Historical uses

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, ` also represented statues of monsters. Starting in NetHack 3.6.0, statues instead use the glyph of the depicted monster.

Variants

Some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 continue to use ` to represent statues.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM uses the same glyphs for statues as NetHack 3.4.3.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, ` is used for statues as well as statue monsters, a new monster class. The glyph is used by the following monsters:

  • ` Punisher

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the '''backtick''' symbol ('''`''') serves the following purposes:

* {{white|`}} represents [[boulder]]s by default. This can be changed with the [[Options#boulder|''boulder'' option]], with the [[0]] glyph ({{white|0}}) being a popular choice.

* Pressing {{kbd|`}} opens up the [[discoveries]] menu, which lets you view what items you have [[identified]] in each object class, whether formally or by [[type-name]].

==Historical uses==
In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, {{white|`}} also represented [[statue]]s of monsters. Starting in [[NetHack 3.6.0]], statues instead use the glyph of the depicted monster.

==Variants==
Some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 continue to use {{white|`}} to represent statues.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] uses the same glyphs for statues as NetHack 3.4.3.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], {{white|`}} is used for statues as well as [[Statue (monster class)|statue monsters]], a new [[monster class]]. The glyph is used by the following monsters:

* {{monsymlink|Punisher}}
